intro: Amaranthus retroflexus var. major, commonly known as redroot pigweed, is an annual weed belonging to the Amaranthaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems that are often reddish in color, and its small, green to red flowers that appear in dense clusters. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and can have a slightly hairy texture. This plant is native to the Americas but has become widespread in many parts of the world, often growing in disturbed soils. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
